item.title: What happens when you use a browser to access google.com
item.description:
So this is just a quick recap of what I have learned about networking

First, you have to connect your computer to the local network. Your computer then will be assigned a local IP by a DHCP server (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol), you cannot use that local IP to talk to the outside network. All the devices in the same local network will use the IP of the gateway to talk to the internet, sometimes itâ€™s called public IP. The protocol to map from local address to public address is called NAT (Network Address Translation).
